interp

Class MooplRunTime

  • java.lang.Object
    • interp.MooplRunTime

  • public class MooplRunTime
extends java.lang.Object
    Run-time state for the Moopl interpreter, comprising heap and call-stack.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int DEFAULT_STACK_SIZE 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MooplRunTime()
      Initialise a new run-time state with default call-stack size.
      MooplRunTime(int stackSize)
      Initialise a new run-time state with a specified call-stack size.

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_STACK_SIZE

        public static int DEFAULT_STACK_SIZE

    • Constructor Detail

      • MooplRunTime

        public MooplRunTime()
        Initialise a new run-time state with default call-stack size. Heap and call-stack are initially empty.

      • MooplRunTime

        public MooplRunTime(int stackSize)
        Initialise a new run-time state with a specified call-stack size. Heap and call-stack are initially empty.
        Parameters:
        stackSize - the call-stack size

    • Method Detail

      • stackIsEmpty

        public boolean stackIsEmpty()
        Is the call stack empty?
        Returns:
        true if the call stack is empty

      • pushFrame

        public void pushFrame(java.lang.Integer self,
                      java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> actuals,
                      int localsCount)
        Push a new stack frame on top of the call stack. Allocates space for method parameters (including "self"), and local variables. Initialises parameters.
        Parameters:
        self - the heap reference of the object which is the target of the method call
        actuals - the actual parameters for the call
        localsCount - the number of slots to allocate for local variables (above the frame pointer)

      • popFrame

        public void popFrame()
        Pop the current stack frame off the call stack.

      • getFrameEntry

        public int getFrameEntry(int offset)
        Retrieve a value from the current stack frame. Local variables are stored at offsets 1, 2, ... Parameters (including "self") are stored at offsets -2, -3, ... Note that the first parameter is "self" at offset -2 (offsets 0 and -1 should not be accessed via this method).
        Parameters:
        offset - an offset from the current frame pointer
        Returns:
        the value stored at the specified offset

      • setFrameEntry

        public void setFrameEntry(int offset,
                          int value)
        Set a value in the current stack frame. Local variables are stored at offsets 1, 2, ... Parameters (including "self") are stored at offsets -2, -3, ... Note that the first parameter is "self" at offset -2 (offsets 0 and -1 should not be accessed via this method).
        Parameters:
        offset - an offset from the current frame pointer
        value - the new value

      • allocClassInstance

        public java.lang.Integer allocClassInstance(int fieldCount,
                                            java.lang.String className)
        Create a class instance object in the heap.
        Parameters:
        fieldCount - how many fields the object will contain
        className - the name of the class of which to create an instance
        Returns:
        the "memory address" of the new object in the heap

      • allocArrayObject

        public java.lang.Integer allocArrayObject(int length,
                                          Type elementType)
        Create a new array object in the heap.
        Parameters:
        length - the length of the array
        elementType - the type of the array elements
        Returns:
        the "memory address" of the new object in the heap

      • deref

        public MooplObject deref(java.lang.Integer a)
        Look up a reference in the heap and return the object found there.
        Parameters:
        a - the "memory address" of the object in the heap
        Returns:
        the object found

      • dumpTopFrame

        public void dumpTopFrame()
        Print the top stack frame to stderr. For debugging purposes.

      • dumpStack

        public void dumpStack()
        Print the stack to stderr. For debugging purposes.
